TextAnnotation Class

In this Article

Represents a text annotation.

Syntax

Declaration

public class TextAnnotation : System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • ChartElement
  • ChartNamedElement
  • System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation
  • TextAnnotation

Remarks

Note that other annotations, such as rectangle and ellipse annotations, can display inner text.

Initializes a new instance of the TextAnnotation class.

EndPlacement()

Ends user placement of an annotation.
StopTextEditing()

Stops end-user editing of the annotation text.

Constructors

  • TextAnnotation()

    Initializes a new instance of the TextAnnotation class.

    public TextAnnotation ();

Properties

  • AnnotationType

    Gets the annotation type.

    public override string AnnotationType { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The annotation type.

    Remarks

    For internal use, should not be used.

  • BackColor

    This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.

    public override System.Drawing.Color BackColor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      A Color value.

    Remarks

    This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.

  • BackGradientStyle

    This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.GradientStyle BackGradientStyle { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • GradientStyle

      A GradientStyle enumeration value.

    Remarks

    This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.

  • BackHatchStyle

    This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHatchStyle BackHatchStyle { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ChartHatchStyle

      A ChartHatchStyle enumeration value.

    Remarks

    This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.

  • BackSecondaryColor

    This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.

    public override System.Drawing.Color BackSecondaryColor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      A Color value.

    Remarks

    This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.

  • Font

    Gets or sets the font for the annotation text.

    public override System.Drawing.Font Font { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Font

      A Font object used as the font for the annotation text.

    Remarks

    To set this property, create a new Font object, and then assign it to this property.

  • IsMultiline

    Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether the annotation text is multiline.

    public virtual bool IsMultiline { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      True if the annotation text is multiline; otherwise, False.

  • LineColor

    This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.

    public override System.Drawing.Color LineColor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      A Color value.

    Remarks

    This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.

  • LineDashStyle

    This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartDashStyle LineDashStyle { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ChartDashStyle

      A ChartDashStyle enumeration value.

    Remarks

    This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.

  • LineWidth

    This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.

    public override int LineWidth { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      An integer value.

    Remarks

    This property is not applicable to the text annotation type.

  • Text

    Gets or sets the text of the annotation.

    public virtual string Text { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string value that represents the text.

Methods

  • BeginTextEditing()

    Begins editing of the annotation text by an end-user.

    public void BeginTextEditing ();

    Remarks

    After calling this method, the annotation displays an editing box that allows the user to edit the annotation text.

    Call the StopTextEditing method to cancel this mode programmatically. Note that editing also ends when the end-user hits the Enter key if the value of the IsMultiline property is false, or when the end-user clicks outside the editing box if the value is true.

  • EndPlacement()

    Ends user placement of an annotation.

    public override void EndPlacement ();

    Remarks

    Ends an annotation placement operation previously started by a BeginPlacement method call. You are not required to call this method, because placement will automatically end when an end-user enters all required points. However, it is useful when an annotation placement operation needs to be aborted for some reason.

  • StopTextEditing()

    Stops end-user editing of the annotation text.

    public void StopTextEditing ();

    Remarks

    Call this method to cancel a text editing operation that was started with a call to the BeginTextEditing method.

    Note that if the end user double-clicks the annotation, the BeginTextEditing method will be automatically called.
